basics.name: Han YANG
basics.label: Undergraduate Researcher in Mathematical Modeling
basics.summary: An undergraduate student at Southwest University with a strong passion for applying mathematical modeling and data analysis to solve complex problems. Proven track record in leading research projects and achieving top awards in national modeling competitions.

work.name: Yunding Mathematical Modeling Agency
work.summary: Short-term employment by the agency to record mathematics competition courses for users.

work.name: Chongqing Jiawo Biotechnology Co., Ltd.
work.summary: Represented the company and presented a solid fertilizer project to investors and experts at the China Innovation and Entrepreneurship Roadshow semi-finals (Chongqing).

work.name: Official National Competition Publication
work.summary: As a freshman, authored an article for a publication featured on the official National Competition website, sharing insights on the Postgraduate Entrance Exam Mathematics Competition.

volunteer.position: Volunteer Tutor, Summer Social Practice Program
volunteer.summary: Participated in the 'Three Trips to the Countryside' summer program, a volunteer initiative to support rural communities. Taught foundational mathematics to left-behind children and those from underprivileged families, and conducted targeted home visits to provide care and support.
highlights: Designed and delivered an engaging math enlightenment curriculum for young learners.

volunteer.organization: Red Cross Association of China, Rongchang Branch
volunteer.summary: Engaged in a variety of community service activities as needed, providing support for multiple public welfare events and initiatives organized by the local Red Cross.

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: ESI-Curvature Modeling of Egg Trajectories: Morphological Effects
projects.summary: Led a team to invent and design an egg rolling test rig, initially collecting 90 egg samples from various locations. Fixed a high-speed camera position, releasing each egg through a lift gate at the same initial velocity to capture video. Innovatively converted 3D motion into 2D planar motion. Utilized MATLAB, based on Kalman filtering and its extended forms, to extract dynamic behavioral features of eggs from video sequences (e.g., trajectory, instantaneous velocity, acceleration, angular velocity, wobble patterns).
highlights: The project has been approved at the university level and is pushing for inclusion in the National Undergraduate Innovation and Entrepreneurship Training Program.

projects.name: Machine Vision for Coupled Egg Dynamics & Intelligent Sorting
projects.summary: Led project members in conducting a literature review on the coupling mechanism of egg morphology, contact interface characteristics, dynamic rolling behavior, and intelligent sorting prediction. Systematically summarized 240 recent review articles in the field, and drafted an initial review manuscript.
highlights: Laid the groundwork for future projects such as developing egg dynamics models and establishing egg grading and recognition systems.

projects.name: Research on Multi-Object Localization of Rocket Debris
projects.summary: Developed a rocket debris recovery strategy using sonic booms by optimizing WGS84-based tri-sphere and quad-sphere intersection models. Employed MATLAB, including 'lsqnonlin' and a novel traversal algorithm, to implement a weighted least squares correction model. This approach, validated by Monte Carlo simulations, significantly enhanced localization accuracy and confirmed the necessity of at least four devices.
highlights: Outputs: Publish the paper titled “Research on Multi-Object Localization of Rocket Debris”.
